comments.author: EnemyCrusher.7324
comments.body: Thanks God Of Fissures! I’ll download them when I get home.

comments.author: God Of Fissures.8627
comments.body:
EDIT: I just made a few really high-res rips from the game archive and made a nice, new, updated WvW map for people to use.

To preserve the quality, they are .BMP’s of around 43MB each. That isn’t a terribly big download and you can compress them anyway once you get them.

http://www.fileswap.com/dl/JCg5TzokO/eternal_battlegrounds_map.bmp.html

http://www.fileswap.com/dl/itzIxNPVCA/borderlands_map.bmp.html

ENJOY!

comments.author: EnemyCrusher.7324
comments.body:
zeeZ.5713:

Those maps are old, and the overlays are mostly there to indicate where stuff is.

AFAIR the walls are just overlays too, hidden somewhere among the billion other textures.

Since the map doesn’t change when the walls go down, I feel like there’s probably a newer version that just has all of the walls in tact. Either such a map or a walls overlay would work fine.

comments.author: zeeZ.5713
comments.body:
Those maps are old, and the overlays are mostly there to indicate where stuff is.

AFAIR the walls are just overlays too, hidden somewhere among the billion other textures.

comments.author: EnemyCrusher.7324
comments.body: Actually would it be possible to get the same maps without all of the walls knocked down?

comments.author: EnemyCrusher.7324
comments.body: Thanks zeeZ, that helps out a lot! The labels have some typos and the orb pedestals are shown, but I’ll use some photoshop/gimp magic to make things work.

comments.author: FourthVariety.5463
comments.body:
The stitching method has the downside of the servername printed across it. One cannot totally disable the entire UI overdraw. Plus there is different languages to consider.

Putting the raw maps without any names and icons into a fansite resource kit might not be a bad idea.

comments.author: Atrophied.8725
comments.body: The FoE wvw map is pretty high resolution if it’s still up and running.

comments.author: CosmicChopsticks.2876
comments.body: You might have to take screenshots when zoomed in and stitch them together, but then you still have the icons to deal with. Putting your own on would cover them at any zoom level though.

comments.author: Marxist Breakfast.9613
comments.body:
Does anyone have one of these, suitable for zooming/panning around in an app? I’ve found high res images for Tyria, but no clean WvW maps. The WvW apps I’ve seen use in-game screenshots, which aren’t really ideal.

Thanks!
